Header: Kyrgyzstan stages third world nomad games
Content: Thousands of people from Kyrgyzstan and abroad gathered at the bank of the famous Issyk-Kul lake to watch traditional nomad sports. Horse riders showed stunts at the opening ceremony of the Third World Nomad games while participants marched in front of the stands. Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan who was in Kyrgyzstan on an official visit saluted the athletes from the top of the stands. This year, Kyrgyzstan invited 2,000 athletes from 80 countries to participate in 37 different ethnic sports including various riding disciplines, archery and several types of wrestling.
